intro: Elymus brachyaristatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wheatgrass, is a perennial grass native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit, often forming dense mats on rocky soils. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets, typical of the Poaceae family. It is well adapted to harsh environments, tolerating drought and poor soil conditions. Elymus brachyaristatus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
